body_html:
At least for gcc it appears they provide a -fabi-version=n flag. We might be able to record the abi version and bake it into the python so you can get torch.whatever.compiler_flags() to tell you what you need to add.

I am not sure if clang and gcc agree on ABIs, however, so we may need to force extension builders to stick to one toolchain.
body_text:
At least for gcc it appears they provide a -fabi-version=n flag. We might be able to record the abi version and bake it into  the python so you can get torch.whatever.compiler_flags() to tell you what you need to add.
I am not sure if clang and gcc agree on ABIs, however, so we may need to force extension builders to stick to one toolchain.
body:
At least for gcc it appears they provide a `-fabi-version=n` flag. We might be able to record the abi version and bake it into  the python so you can get `torch.whatever.compiler_flags()` to tell you what you need to add.

I am not sure if clang and gcc agree on ABIs, however, so we may need to force extension builders to stick to one toolchain.
